text:
Example, say, the NEW_DIR is C:\a\b\c, and try the follwing

<property name="new.dir" location="${env.NEW_DIR}"/>
<target name="replace">
<copy overwrite="yes" file="my.script" tofile="$temp.script">
<filterset>
<filter token="NEW_DIR" value="${new.dir}"/>
</filterset>
</copy>
</target>

@NEW_DIR@ is replaced but the resulting string is stripped off all backslash 
characters (not substituted by / character, either).  So, the C:\a\b\c becomes 
C:abc.

Try to echo "${new.dir}"
The filter works fine for me with backslashes
